ideas.title: Eerie Footprints
ideas.body: An invisible entity that leaves footprints behind as it walks. The footprints could be muddy, bloody, or use a variety of different textures based on the blocks it walked on. This could be a hostile entity, an ambient entity that is just part of the world, or maybe a neutral mob with a unique interaction.

ideas.title: Graveyard Structure
ideas.body: Graveyard or cemetery structures that generate in the world. They could be part of villages, or generate at random. These structures could be simple ambience or provide a way to encounter undead mobs.

ideas.title: Moths
ideas.body: An ambient moth mob that flies around at night and sleeps during the day. They are attracted to lanterns and other light sources and could potentially have the ability to extinguish them. Moths are arthropods and would fit with the theme of all bug/insect mobs in Minecraft being arthropods.

ideas.title: Phantom Tools & Armor
ideas.body: Old tools and armor that have been possessed by an unseen force. This could be a temporary effect, or a hostile mob that attacks the player.

ideas.title: Bone Piles
ideas.body: A pile of bones laying on the ground that reassembles into a skeleton mob when the player gets near. These could potentially spawn as part of a new structure. When the mob is killed, it could potentially revert back into a pile of bones temporarily like the Dry Bones enemy in Mario or mummies in Stardew Valley.

ideas.title: Scarecrow
ideas.body: A scarecrow block that can boost the growth rate of nearby crop blocks. They could come in a variety of different colors and styles. If one is struck by lightning, it could come to life and become a hostile mob.

ideas.title: Cursed Bookshelves
ideas.body: A bookshelf block that sometimes play creepy whispering sound effects, as if the books are speaking to the player. These could be crafted by players or potentially replace some vanilla bookshelves in existing structures. There could be some type of interaction if the player interacts with this shelf, like giving them EXP and reverting back to normal.

ideas.title: Wolf Creatures
ideas.body: New wolf variants based on creepy legends like Black Shuck, Hell hounds, skeletal wolves, etc. These wolves could be hostile or tamable variants of the wolf.

ideas.title: Scraps of Lore
ideas.body: Scraps of paper or old books with lore and ghost stories written in them. These could be rarely found in loot chests, fishing, or from mob drops.

ideas.title: Screenshot Entity
ideas.body: An entity that is completely invisible to the player outside of screenshots. The entity could be completely invisible in-game, only visible for a few frames during the screenshot, or taking a screenshot would permanently reveal it.

ideas.title: Invisible Ink
ideas.body: An item that makes sign text invisible until it is revealed using an item. The item could be a held item or something the player uses on the sign to undo the invisibility.

ideas.title: Cursed Compass
ideas.body: A variant of the compass that leads the player towards danger rather than their spawn point. These could be placed in loot chests and trick players.

ideas.title: Motion Entity
ideas.body: An entity that players can only see if they stand completely still. While it does not need to be hostile, having it attack under certain circumstances could provide unique combat opportunities.

ideas.title: Possessed Book
ideas.body: A book that slowly writes new pages on its own. Things like creepy messages, reference things the player did, or give them coordinates or advice to lure them somewhere.

ideas.title: Tree Tapping
ideas.body: A tree tap block that allows players to collect various types of saps and syrups like maple syrup. These items could be used in food or as a substitute for honeycomb and slimeballs.

ideas.title: Smores
ideas.body: Allow players to cook smores together at a campfire. This could be a thing players just do for fun, or the smores could provide temporary buffs when eaten.

ideas.title: Mushroom Rain Boost
ideas.body: Make mushrooms grow more after rain. This could look like making vanilla spread more after a rainfall or adding new types of mushrooms that only appear after it rains.

ideas.title: Fall Decorations
ideas.body: Decorations that fit with the fall aesthetic, like harvest baskets, scarecrows, and acorns.

ideas.title: Ghost Structures
ideas.body: A structure that completely disappears when the player leaves. For example the player takes refuge in an old cottage or explores an abandoned tower, and when they return the structure has completely vanished, leaving only the blocks they placed behind. This idea is inspired by the horror trope of a protagonist finding out a location never existed or was destroyed a long time ago.

ideas.title: Faceless villagers
ideas.body: A villager that has no face. This could be a temporary effect like the player is hallucinating, a permanent effect on an individual mob, or potentially even villages full of faceless villagers.

ideas.title: Ocean Shadows
ideas.body: Massive shadows under the surface of the water to create the illusion that something is down there. This would primarily be an illusion, but you could also just add massive underwater creatures.

ideas.title: Angler Fish
ideas.body: A mob inspired by the angler fish that lures players into the depths of the ocean. This mob would almost certainly be hostile, but it wouldn't target players unless they get close enough.

ideas.title: Ghost Ships
ideas.body: Abandoned ship structures that can be found in the ocean. They could potentially have ghost pirates, skeleton pirates, or similar creepy mobs on them.

ideas.title: Face Collector
ideas.body: A mini-boss type mob that would keep track of the players it kills and somehow collect their faces. For example it could have their player heads in a bag, jar, or even on spikes on its back. This could also be a way to collect player heads without commands.

ideas.title: Navigation Disruption
ideas.body: A mob that makes navigation items fail. Compasses point at it instead of spawn, clocks show the wrong time, and maps display fake markers.

ideas.title: Grinning Mobs
ideas.body: Humanoid mobs like players or villagers that have unnaturally big smiles.

ideas.title: Bermuda Triangle Biome
ideas.body: An ocean biome with thick fog, weird lights, and subtle effects that disrupt navigations like turning boats slightly off course.

ideas.title: Cute Witchcraft
ideas.body: A witchcraft mod that focuses on the cute aesthetic rather than the dark and morbid stuff. Stuff like Kiki's Delivery Service, cute animal mages, cozy cottage core witches.

ideas.title: Potion Minigame
ideas.body: A new brewing system with a puzzle based minigame. Could be like a mario party minigame where your performance in the game determines the quality of the potion.

ideas.title: Friendly Ghosts
ideas.body: Friendly ghosts that help the player out, kind of like the Allay. They could scare off raiders, help find items, or help you fly temporarily.

ideas.title: Witch Familiars
ideas.body: Different kinds of familiars that players can collect. Each one gives the player a different effects.

ideas.title: Potion Expansion
ideas.body: A wide range of new potion materials and new types of potions with interesting effects. Like a recall potion that teleports the user back to the location they drank the potion when the effect expires, or take on the appearance of another mob or player.

ideas.title: Candy
ideas.body: Add new types of candy to the game. The more unique and interesting the better. Candy could be based on your real world favorites, or take inspiration from the various mobs and concepts in Minecraft.

ideas.title: Enchanted Postcards
ideas.body: An enchanted postcard item that teleports the user to the location when they use the item. This would be a single use item and would not provide the player a way back home. These postcards could be created using a magical camera or traded to the player by the wandering trader.

ideas.title: Green Rain
ideas.body: A weather effect that temporarily turns rain green. While this is happening plants grow a bit faster. The rain should create an unsettling atmosphere and may be able to mutate crops or cause hostile plant creatures to spawn. This idea is inspired by the green rain event in Stardew Valley.

ideas.title: Ambient Birds
ideas.body: Birds that add to the ambience of the world. For example crows that caw occasionally. Perhaps players could tame crows using shiny objects.

ideas.title: Nether Portal Spread
ideas.body: Nether portals slowly spread corruption into the real world. You could potentially add different ways to contain the spread, making players put more consideration into where and how they build their portals.

ideas.title: Face Changer
ideas.body: A new mob that visually changes in some way if you look away from it. The change should be eerie or unsettling in some way. For example a mob that changes facial expression, model, or texture.

ideas.title: Spider Lairs
ideas.body: A spider lair structure that players can explore. The lair would contain cobwebs, mobs trapped in webbing, different types of spiders, and spider egg sacs. At the heart of the lair players can find a giant spider mini-boss.

ideas.title: Fairy Circles
ideas.body: A ring of mushrooms that randomly generates in forests. In folklore these rings are often associated with witches and magic. In some cases stepping in to a fairy circle will curse you or transport you into another world. One way these could be implements in Minecraft is by warping the player very far away with no direct way to return.

ideas.title: Moth People
ideas.body: Small humanoids with visual elements inspired by moths. These could draw inspiration from the legends of moth man, being hostile mobs that attack at night. Alternatively they could be a new neutral kind of villagers that trade with the player.

ideas.title: Creepy Fog Event
ideas.body: A heavy fog weather event that causes weird sounds to play. New types of hostile mobs could spawn in the fog that will hunt players down. After the fog clears these mobs should also disappear. This idea draws inspiration from The Mist by Stephen King.

ideas.title: Cursed Light Sources
ideas.body: Light sources like lanterns and torches that attract hostile mobs and cause them to spawn more instead of repelling them. Kind of like the water candle in Terraria.

ideas.title: Ancient Crypts
ideas.body: Giant crypt structure that generates under ground. These should be full of skeletal mobs like the skeleton.

ideas.title: Monster Tools
ideas.body: A wide range of tools to deal with hostile mobs. For example weapons that are more effective against hostile mobs, wards to keep them away, or even ways to capture them.

ideas.title: Dark Deals
ideas.body: A villager that offers valuable items in exchange for permanently debuffing the player. For example a trade that will lower the players maximum health, or something that will make them slower.

ideas.title: Blood Moon
ideas.body: A rare blood moon event that causes hostile mobs to spawn more frequently. The mobs that spawn should be harder to deal with than usual. You could even design new mobs or variants of existing ones that spawn during the blood moon.

ideas.title: Candle Magic
ideas.body: A candle based magic system that allows players to perform spells by arranging candles in certain patterns. These spells could summon mobs, grant temporary buffs, or perform other cool effects.

ideas.title: Abandoned Structures
ideas.body: Add new structures to the world that feel abandoned or run down. This could be stuff like old amusement parks, or abandoned villages. Maybe there are new mobs that lurk inside these structures.

ideas.title: Repeating Staircase
ideas.body: A mysterious staircase or structure that teleports the player in a way that makes it seem infinite. This is a common horror trope that has been used in many games and stories.

ideas.title: Pumpkin Golems
ideas.body: Different kinds of golems that wear pumpkins on their heads. These could be decorative or provide some form of utility like scaring mobs away.

ideas.title: Pumpkin Boss
ideas.body: A giant pumpkin boss with long vines that lash at nearby mobs and players. The boss should be summoned by players somehow and drop interesting items.

ideas.title: Bio-Tech
ideas.body: A tech mod that uses flesh, organs, and biological elements instead of traditional machinery. For example veins instead of wires, beating hearts instead of pumps, and a crusher that uses teeth instead of metal blades.

ideas.title: Ghostly Mobs
ideas.body: Ghosts, wraiths, and spectres! Souls of the dead that roam the lands. Maybe they can give the frightened debuff, preventing you from using items or attacking temporarily.

ideas.title: Zombie Tropes
ideas.body: Various types of zombies, pulling inspiration from common zombie tropes. Like Crawlers which are fast, explosive zombies, etc.

ideas.title: Skeleton Lumberjack
ideas.body: Skeleton Lumberjack who lurk in the forrest. They come in an assortment of colors, and have a special axe that can fell trees quicker or use less durability on logs.

ideas.title: Headless Mobs
ideas.body: Headless mobs, like the headless horseman who has a pumpkin in place of their head.

ideas.title: Poltergeists
ideas.body: Dark spirits that lurk in caves and attack by levitating nearby blocks and objects and tossing them at the player.

ideas.title: Vampires
ideas.body: Vampires, bat-winged creatures who hunt at night and hate the daylight. Would heal from attacking and can use a sonic wave attack like the warden.

ideas.title: Mummies
ideas.body: Mummies, bandaged undead mobs that roam sandy biomes at night. Maybe they can stretch their arms or release toxic clouds. Lighting them on fire could turn them into vanilla husks.

ideas.title: Turkeys
ideas.body: Add turkeys as an ambient mob to forests.

ideas.title: Rats
ideas.body: Rats and vermin that eat your crops and lurk in dark areas. Maybe include mouse traps to deal with them.

ideas.title: Night Birds
ideas.body: Peaceful night birds like owls that make hooting sounds.

ideas.title: Pumpkin Creatures
ideas.body: Pumpkin creatures like Jack O' Lantern mimics, crawling pumpkin spiders, and maybe even actual pumpkin people who have a secret society and want you specifically to be deceased?

ideas.title: Wisps
ideas.body: Ghostly flames called wisps that drift through forested biomes at night. Maybe they come in different colors that do different things inspired by coices of the void.

ideas.title: Living Armor
ideas.body: Living suits of armor that stay still at day and move after dark. Maybe they are part of a new structure or use a new type of weapon like spears.

ideas.title: Tric-or-Treaters
ideas.body: Trick-or-treaters, humanoid creatures dressed in costumes. Bring them candy or sweets for a reward. Maybe there is also a trick variant that tries to harm you, or play a trick on you.

ideas.title: Abandoned Farmhouse
ideas.body: Old farmhouse structure with barns, ruined crops, scarecrows, and fall themed crops like gourds or corn.

ideas.title: Undead Structures
ideas.body: Graveyards, crypts, catacombs, and similar structures with grave robbing potential. Maybe undead skulk through at night.

ideas.title: Gothic Castles
ideas.body: Large gothic castles or haunted medieval fortresses, maybe they are strongholds for mobs like vampires.

ideas.title: Abandoned Campfires
ideas.body: Campfires with log seats, tents, and maybe other camping items. The campsite is abandoned and it looks like they left in a hurry.

ideas.title: Haunted Mansions
ideas.body: A haunted mansion filled with ghosts, deathtraps, and puzzles!

ideas.title: Creepy Decorations
ideas.body: Creepy decorations like broken mirrors, creepy paintings, mannequins, worn down furniture, dolls, torture devices, placeable blood splatters, placeable books, bones, eerie statues, webs.

ideas.title: Pumpkin Moon Event
ideas.body: A recreation of the pumpkin moon event from terraria.

ideas.title: Spooky Candy
ideas.body: Gather weird or spooky ingredients to make your own candy at a confection station.

ideas.title: Ancient Hellhound Boss
ideas.body: A mini-boss inspired by the Ancient Hellhound from Ultima Online.

ideas.title: Yokai
ideas.body: A mod inspired by Japanese yokai like the Karakasa, a one-eyed hopping umbrella monster.

ideas.title: Spooky Cosmetics
ideas.body: A bunch of hats and cosmetics that can be used as halloween costumes. Maybe there is a special merchant who sells costumes or a goodie bag that can be found in chests.
